definition: to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode

sentences.english: Do you found stamp collect or gardening more to your taste?
sentences.chinese: 您覺得是集郵還是園藝更合您的口味？

sentences.english: Philately pingpong roller skating reading and music.
sentences.chinese: 集郵乒乓球輪滑讀書和音樂。

sentences.english: Stamp collecting as well as fishing is Mr. Evan's favorite avocation.
sentences.chinese: 集郵以及釣魚都是艾文先生最喜歡的業餘愛好。

sentences.english: I am a committee member of the Philatelist Association of our university.
sentences.chinese: 我是我們大學裏集郵家協會的成員。

sentences.english: My husband is a stamp collector.
The flattery monacal is a philatelic.
sentences.chinese: 那個阿諛的修道士是個集郵愛好者。

sentences.english: I will trade my stamp collection for your model boat.
sentences.chinese: 我用我的集郵冊換你的模型船。

sentences.english: It was not until 1982 that the philatelic association got re-established.
sentences.chinese: 直到1982年，該集郵社團才得以恢復。

sentences.english: One of my pursuits is collecting stamps?
sentences.chinese: 我的一個愛好就是集郵？

sentences.english: One of us told her that we were stamp collectors.
sentences.chinese: 其中一個朋友告訴她我們是集郵的。

sentences.english: Nothing but two of my albumswas stolen.
sentences.chinese: 除了我的兩本集郵簿外別的沒有被盜。

sentences.english: They want to organize a stamp-collecting club.
sentences.chinese: 他們想組織一個集郵俱樂部。

sentences.english: It's not too much to say that an album of stamps is a small encyclopedia book.
sentences.chinese: 可以說一本集郵冊就是一本小的百科全書。

sentences.english: You can make an album with this book.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用這本書做集郵冊。

sentences.english: Audiovisual and computer formatted philatelic programs, Web pages included.
sentences.chinese: 音像和計算機程序格式化集郵，網頁中。

sentences.english: In spite of the global financial instability the year was rich in interesting philatelic events.
sentences.chinese: 儘管2009年全球金融動盪，但集郵活動豐富有趣。

definition: specific topic (addressed by a book, lecture, TV program etc)/article, report or program etc on a specific topic
to fulfill one's dream/(divination) to predict the future by interpreting a dream/oneiromancy

dramatic form consisting of historical narration/history as jocular narrative/to stretch history for a joking story/amusing story with strained interpretations of history/to make an unreasonable comparison in jest
to rush (to do sth urgent)/to try to be the first/to forestall
